instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 350˚F (180˚C).
Add the bread cubes to a medium bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, ½ teaspoon salt, and ½ teaspoon black pepper until well coated.
Spread the bread cubes in an even layer on a baking sheet. Toast for 15 minutes, until golden brown.

In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, whisk together the shallot, garlic, mustard, vinegar, remaining teaspoon of pepper, and 1 teaspoon salt. Slowly drizzle in ¼ cup olive oil, whisking constantly, until the dressing is emulsified. Set aside.

Heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the corn and cook, stirring, until charred in spots, about 5 minutes. Season with the remaining ½ teaspoon salt.
Transfer the corn to a large bowl and add the toasted bread cubes, tomatoes, mozzarella, and dressing. Toss well. Add the basil and toss again to incorporate.
Enjoy!

results.name: Summer Panzanella

components.raw_text: ½ small loaf of country bread, cubed (about 5 cups)
¼ cup plus 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1½ teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, divided
4 medium heirloom tomatoes, cut into 1-inch pieces
½ pound fresh mozzarella cheese, torn into pieces
1 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves

results.description: This simple panzanella salad let’s summer’s best flavors shine. Serve at your next backyard barbecue or poolside potluck--it’s sure to be a hit!
results.keywords: easy lunch, homemade dressing, panzanella recipe, quick appetizer, summer salad, tasty, tomato and corn, veggie packed

components.extra_comment: husked and cut crosswise into 6 pieces
components.raw_text: 3 ears corn, husked and cut crosswise into 6 pieces
1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 12.8-ounce package smoked andouille sausage, thinly sliced

compilations.name: Amazing Sheet Pan Recipes For Get Togethers
compilations.description: Hosting a party can be a stressful task, but your handy dandy sheet pan makes the job a whole lot easier. Assemble a sandwich sheet tray for a picnic with friends or throw a fiesta with our sheet-pan steak fajitas. Want something everyone can enjoy? Try our sheet pan shrimp boil. There's nothing more magical than a sheet pan!

compilations.name: 25 Amazing Dinners From Tasty
compilations.description: Can't decide what to cook for your family? We've got you covered! Here are 25 of the best dinners you can make. Low on time and want to keep it simple? Try our easy veggie curry. Or, if you're in the mood to treat everyone to something fancy, make our French pepper steak. It’s a guaranteed way to impress your dinner table.

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C).
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook potatoes until just tender and parboiled, about 10-13 minutes. Stir in corn during the last 5 minutes of cooking time and drain well.
In a small bowl, combine butter, garlic, and Old Bay Seasoning.
Place potatoes, corn, shrimp and sausage in a single layer onto a greased baking sheet. Gently toss with the butter mixture.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque and corn is tender.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges, and sprinkle with parsley.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Looking for simple, easy-to-make corn on the cob recipes? Start with these! You can serve them with just about anything, and you can switch up the flavors — like zesty chili lime or cheesy garlic Parmesan — depending on what you’re craving. They’re the perfect snack for a summer afternoon and are ready to eat in no time.
compilations.name: Corn on the Cob Summer Recipes

compilations.description: Everyone's favorite time of the year is here: It's BBQ season! Whether you're planning on throwing a big BBQ party in your backyard or you're simply craving some solo grillin' time, these juicy mouthwatering recipes have got you covered! Let's fire up those grills and get cookin'!
compilations.name: Easy Backyard BBQ Recipes!

compilations.description: We bet you're already ready for summer adventures, but these recipes will get you super psyched. Kick off your day with some melon salad for breakfast and indulge in this epic peach iced tea whiskey throughout the day. Whether you want to cool off, usher in the sun, or stay cool, these recipes are here for all your summer needs!
compilations.name: 7 Recipes To Get You Psyched For Summer

results.name: Garlic Parmesan Grilled Corn
results.keywords: , 4 ways, butter, buzzfeed, cayenne, cheese, chile, chili, chive, cob, cook how to, corn, corn on the cob, cotija, ear, elote, full, garlic, grilled, herb, honey, mayo, olive oil, parmesean, parsley, pepper, recipe, roasted, salt, scallion, sesame, sriracha, tasty, thyme, yum, yummy

instructions.display_text: Preheat a grill or grill plate to medium heat.
Drizzle the corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix to ensure all the ears are evenly coated.
Place the corn on the grill. Close the lid to keep the temperature high, and let the corn cook for about 15 minutes per side, or until slightly charred on all sides.
Remove the corn from the heat and set aside.
Place the garlic and butter in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1 minute, or until melted.
Brush the garlic butter on the corn. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.
Enjoy!
Combine all the ingredients above in a large bowl.
Mix the dressing ingredients together and spread over fruit, mix well.
Enjoy!

Easy Snacks To Pack For Your Next Beach Trip
compilations.description: Planning a trip to the beach to celebrate the coming of summer? These easy snacks will make sure you're fueled and ready for the next game of water polo. From parmesan garlic & herb pita chips to super easy to make banana roll-ups, these treats are beach-friendly and hassle free. So what are you waiting for? Pack up your picnic basket with these goodies: summer's here!

Fruit bowls are all the rage: acai, smoothie, you name it! They're refreshing, juicy and absolutely delicious. You might find yourself wondering, "What if I could have a fruit bowl, everyday?" Lucky for you, we're here to make that dream a reality. When the mid-week blues get the better of you, test out our Watermelon Salad with Arugula & Feta. Then, kick the blues away with our Honey Lime Rainbow Fruit Salad. It's time to eat the rainbow and, well, it's never been better.
compilations.name: Fresh Fruit Salads For A Whole Week!

compilations.description: Feeling like going on a health kick? No worries, we've got you covered! Start your day with a super delicious tropical fruit salad, then munch on some keto-friendly parmesan crisps for when you're craving something savory. Eating healthy can still be flavorful, fabulous, and fun with everything we have to offer.
compilations.name: Recipes For When You're Trying To Eat Healthy
